content.question:
A 90 percent confidence interval for the proportion difference <math alttext="p sub 1 minus p sub 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>p</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow></msub><mo>âˆ’</mo><msub><mrow><mi>p</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math> was calculated to be <math alttext="0.247 comma 0.325" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mo>(</mo><mrow><mn>0.247</mn><mo>,</mo><mn>0.325</mn></mrow><mo>)</mo></mrow></mstyle></math>.
Which of the following conclusions is supported by the interval?

choices.label: There is evidence to conclude that <math alttext="p sub 1 is greater than p sub 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>p</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow></msub><mo>></mo><msub><mrow><mi>p</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math> because 0.325 is greater than 0.247.

There is evidence to conclude that <math alttext="p sub 1 is less than p sub 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>p</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow></msub><mo><</mo><msub><mrow><mi>p</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math> because 0.325 is greater than 0.247.

There is evidence to conclude that <math alttext="p sub 1 is greater than p sub 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>p</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow></msub><mo>></mo><msub><mrow><mi>p</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math> because all values in the interval are positive.

There is evidence to conclude that <math alttext="p sub 1 is less than p sub 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>p</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow></msub><mo><</mo><msub><mrow><mi>p</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math> because all values in the interval are positive.

There is evidence to conclude that <math alttext="p sub 2 is greater than p sub 1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>p</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><mo>></mo><msub><mrow><mi>p</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math> because 0.247 and 0.325 are both greater than 0.05.

content.answer: There is evidence to conclude that <math alttext="p sub 1 is greater than p sub 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>p</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow></msub><mo>></mo><msub><mrow><mi>p</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math> because all values in the interval are positive.

topic.text: 6.9: Justifying a Claim Based on a Confidence Interval for a Difference Between Population Proportions

skill.text: Skill 4.D: Justify a claim based on a confidence interval.
